intro: Clidemia rhodolasia, commonly known as the red-flowered mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and typically grows on the branches of other plants, deriving some of its nutrients from its host. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and small, clustered white or red flowers. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. Clidemia rhodolasia plays a role in local ecosystems by providing food for various wildlife species.
